headline: At This Hour
subHeadline: U.N. Security Council Holds Meeting On Anniversary Of War; China Unveils 12-Point Plan For Ending War In Ukraine; Alex Murdaugh Testifies In His Murder Trial. Aired 11:30a-12p ET

utterances.speaker: KATE BOLDUAN, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: At this hour, the United Nations Security Council is holding a critical meeting on the war in Ukraine as the world marks one year since Russia's unprovoked invasion. We just heard a little while ago from the Secretary of State, Tony Blinken, in a blistering and important speech. And in Ukraine, President Zelenskyy is also speaking this morning and promising victory for his country in 2023. He's also once again pushing for more support from the West in order to pull it off.For Russia's part, they show no signs of letting up, of course, the -- with ongoing shelling in Ukraine's east and south, killing at least three civilians and injuring several others in just the last 24 hours. And make no mistake. The war is reaching a critical juncture as Ukraine is preparing for an unexpected Russian spring offensive. And in a new interview with CNN, Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin discussed the role that China could play in the next year of this war if China begins providing lethal support to Russia as is feared. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) LLOYD AUSTIN, U.S. DEFENSE SECRETARY: We've not seen any -- China provides any material assistance to Ukraine -- to Russia at this point. China hasn't taken that -- taken that off the table for sure. I engaged my counterpart early on and told him that this would be a very bad mistake if China were to do this. It would further complicate things.

utterances.speaker: KAITLAN COLLINS, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: And do you think they're preparing to do that?

utterances.speaker: AUSTIN
utterances.sentences: I don't -- I can't speak for the Chinese. I mean, they have tremendous capabilities. And so, again, if they were to do that, it would be ill-advised.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: VOLODYMYR ZELENSKYY, PRESIDENT OF UKRAINE
utterances.sentences: (Speaking in a foreign language)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: If we all do our homework, we -- victory will be inevitable. I am certain there will be victory. I don't think I want it this year. We have everything for it. We have the motivation, certainty, the friends, you, the diplomacy, you have all come together for this.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: MARQUARDT
utterances.sentences: He said we have everything for it. We have the tools for it. He certainly has the support. And he has a year's worth of international aid from countries all around the world, Kate. But we've also heard him, particularly when he met with President Biden just a few days ago saying that there are still things that Ukraine is pushing for in terms of weapons, that they feel that they need to push the Russians out of this country, including longer-range missiles, and perhaps for the longer-term fighter jets.The fight is obviously extremely active. It is despite the fact that the front line is relatively stagnant. There is a huge demand from the Ukrainian side for weapons not just in terms of increased sophistication, but in increased speed. Because there is an expectation that Russia will carry out a new offensive that we're already seeing the early stages of. But that Ukraine itself wants to go on a new counter-offensive against the Russians. Kate. BOLDUAN: Alex, thank you very much. Let's talk more about China and the new and increased focus on China's role -- potential role in Ukraine. China's calling for a ceasefire in Ukraine and for peace talks to begin as soon as possible. Those proposals are part of a new 12-Point Plan that China put out today as Beijing faces mounting questions over its growing relationship with Russia and also facing new accusations from the secretary of state that it's trying to have it both ways when it comes to Ukraine. Kylie Atwood is live at the United Nations where the Secretary of State just spoke. Kylie, what's -- what was Blinken's message to the UN Security Council just now?

utterances.speaker: KYLIE ATWOOD, CNN NATIONAL SECURITY CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Well, listen. The secretary of state made an incredibly powerful message that the world cannot accept what Russia is doing in Ukraine as the new normal. Saying that the world cannot grow numb to the atrocities that are happening, saying Bucha isn't normal, attacks, bombings on schools and hospitals isn't normal, reminding folks of just how incredible these atrocities that Russia has carried out over the last year over the course of this war have really been.He also took stock on what the United States has done, what the international community has done to support Ukraine over the last year while Ukraine has so valiantly defended itself. Listen to his reflections. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) ANTONY BLINKEN, U.S. SECRETARY OF STATE: When President Putin couldn't break the Ukrainian military, he intensified efforts to break Ukrainian spirits. Over the last year, Russia has killed tens of thousands of Ukrainian men, women, and children, uprooted more than 13 million people from their homes, destroyed more than half of the country's energy grid, bombed more than 700 hospitals, 2600 schools and abducted at least 6000 Ukrainian children, some as young as four months old, and relocated them to Russia. And yet, the spirit of the Ukrainians remains unbroken. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: ATWOOD
utterances.sentences: Now, he also said that no member of the council should call for peace while also supporting Russia's war. And what that appeared to be was a jab at the Chinese peace proposal that you were just discussing, Kate, that the Chinese put out today. Because what the United States has repeatedly said over the course of the last few days, weeks and months is that China is trying to have it both ways here.They are trying to publicly say that they are someone who's trying to broker peace but they're not actually doing that. They are actually siding with the Russians. They're providing economic support to Russia, providing non-lethal support to Russia potentially providing lethal support to Russia. The secretary of state calls for a just and durable peace. Kate.

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: Yes, just and durable peace. Thank you, Kylie. It's great to see you.Let's get to Russia now where the world is watching for clues as to what Vladimir Putin's next move will be. You know, we're actually going to need to go directly right now though, back to South Carolina because the court is now back in session in the double murder trial of Alex Murdaugh. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: CLIFTON NEWMAN, SOUTH CAROLINA CIRCUIT COURT JUDGE
utterances.sentences: You bring the jury.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: They'll be out now.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE) record before the jury comes in?

utterances.speaker: NEWMAN
utterances.sentences: There'll be an opportunity to put something on the record. If it's regarding an objection, it can be done later.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The jury is ready, sir.

utterances.speaker: NEWMAN
utterances.sentences: Thank you. You may proceed.

utterances.speaker: CREIGHTON WATERS, LEAD PROSECUTOR
utterances.sentences: When you picked up that chicken, was there any blood on it?

utterances.speaker: ALEX MURDAUGH, MURDER DEFENDANT
utterances.sentences: I don't believe so.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Did you wash your hands are all?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: At that point in time, I don't believe that I did.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And when you say you were there, you said Maggie was nearby you. Is that correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Right by me.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Was she messing with the hose at all?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: At that time, no. She was not.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Does she mess with it the entire time that you were there according to your new facts today?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: While I was there, she did not touch -- she was not fooling with a hose at all.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. all right, I'm going to move this thing along. I'm going to put up on the screen states 519 which is the condensed timeline. If I could have that computer input, please?

utterances.speaker: JIM GRIFFIN, DEFENSE ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE) 519? WATERS

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Can you see that out there, Mr. Murdaugh?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. I'm on page five. Do you see that cell tower down there?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That is up on my screen?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I do see that.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Would you agree with me that it reflects no cell tower activity on your phone from 6

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I do agree with that.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Let me ask you this, Mr. Murdaugh. Would you take your phone with you down to the kennels, according to the new facts that you testified to yesterday and today?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I must not have.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You must not have?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: If this is accurate, no, sir.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Is that typical for you?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Sure, it is. Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. Tell me why that's simple.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: If and when I'm going. Now, it wouldn't be -- it would be unusual if I was going out for any extended period of time if I was going -- even on a property, if I was going somewhere for an extended period of time, I would usually have my phone. But for me to go -- no one and I'm going to the kennel and coming right back, that's not unusual at all.I mean, there's very -- you've heard the testimony about the service out there. The service is terrible. You have to be in a particular spot.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: And you have to find a spot.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: So, the answer is you don't know whether or not you took it down there?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I believe that I probably did it based on this data.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Based on this. But unlike the photographic memory about other things, you don't remember whether or not you had your phone on you.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: It feels like you don't remember, according to your new story, the last conversation you had with Maggie?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, I remember -- I remember having the con -- my last conversation with Maggie.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Looking at this screen, you have the map up there on page six and it shows you arriving back at Moselle at 6

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, that's what the -- this data appears to show.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Now, I'm looking at the data. Moving on to page seven, you have Paul arriving at about 7

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Well, this one says he arrives at 4147 Moselle Road, which is the address of the shop. The house is 4157. I believe that Paul actually got there a little bit before that. But I think that's approximately accurate. I think Paul got there a little bit closer to seven o'clock.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. You would agree that's the earliest data point that reflects his presence in Moselle?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: If that's what the record show.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And you don't dispute that?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't dispute it, that's -- if that's the earliest data point. But again, I believe he got there a little bit earlier. And I tried to look at these records to see if I could just -- if that could be refuted. And I believe he got there a little closer to seven or a little bit before seven.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: No, it's a good point. You looked at these records a lot before you had your testimony yesterday and today, didn't you, Mr. Murdaugh?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I've looked at these records other than the OnStar records that just came when they were provided to me. Sure, I looked at them.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. Right here, we have some steps on your phone, 29 steps. And then down at the bottom, we have 89 steps. Is that consistent when you and Paul were together on the property? MURDAUGH

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And 8

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: If that's what these records show, I see. I took steps -- this record show I took steps between 8

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. So, would you concede then that you're at the house around 8

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I would have thought so. Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. And you said Paul was already back at that point?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No. I said just the opposite.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: When did he get there?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: All right. Are you talking about when I left the shop and went to the house when Maggie was there?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Before you ate dinner.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, as I said earlier, Paul and I were at the shop. Maggie got home. I left Paul at the shop and I went to the house. I think you were saying that I said I met Paul at the house. And that's incorrect.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Paul was still down at the shop when you were at the house. Correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: When I first went to the house, Paul was still at the shop I believe.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. And was Maggie there when you arrived at the house?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Yes, I believe she was.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. And eight or nine is the last step that you have on this phone before 9

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That's what the data shows.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: This record appears to show Paul at the house at 8

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. So, those records don't fit with your new story that you've testified yesterday and today. Is that correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, I don't -- I don't believe even right now, Mr. Waters, if that's right. I'm not saying -- what you're doing is you're taking 8Now, did Paul come right behind me? I'm not sure. But when I -- when I left him, I believe that -- when I left to go to the house, I believe that Paul stayed at the shop for a minute.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: When you got to the house, did you put your phone down?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I'm sure I did.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Did you put it in the car, in the Suburban?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Did I put it in the Suburban?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: When you got back to the house, did you put it in the Suburban? Was the Suburban parked out front?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: The Suburban would have parked -- been parked wherever I parked it.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Which is where?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I believe on the side.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. And did you put the phone -- your phone in the Suburban?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: At that time? No, I did not.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Where'd you put it?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I'm not sure where I put it.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You're not sure about that either, huh?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, I'm not sure. When I went in the house, I'm not sure where I put my phone. I would think that I -- you know, I would think that I put it down somewhere. Probably about a couch.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Didn't you testify yesterday when you were being asked by your lawyer about that pause of Alameda when you were living -- leaving, and you had a very specific recollection of your phone had fallen down in the crevice and you had to pick it up and get it out? Do you remember testifying to that?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I do.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: But you don't remember what you do with your phone when you got back at this point, huh? MURDAUGH

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I would -- I would assume that when I went into the house, I put it somewhere, either on the table, you go by going to the -- go into the couch, I may have taken it to the bathroom when I take a shower

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: That console story (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: -- it may have taken me a few minutes to go to the shower. So, I can't tell you exactly where I put it.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: That console story is an -- that console story is an awful specific recommend -- recollection when you need it to try and make the new story that this jury is here and everyone's hearing yesterday and today with the data, correct? But you're awful fuzzy on far more important things, aren't you, Mr. Murdaugh?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Which question -- here, I'll answer the first one first. No.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't believe that's convenient. And I disagree with your categorization of the description.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. But you remember the console story but you don't remember where you put your phone whether or not you took it down to the kennels, whether it was on the -- you put it in the Suburban. You don't remember any of that but you remember that console story, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Well, I don't remember the console story but you know in that Suburban -- and it's not the first time that it happened. But when that phone got down there, you had to go to great efforts to get it out. And you couldn't just reach over there and get it out.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Do you say when you got to the house that Maggie was already there?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. Now, we saw your last steps were at 8

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Well, that's what you saw when my -- this data recorded my last steps but as you heard his testimony too, Mr. Waters, you know that's not a precise -- that's not a precise -- you heard the testimony. You know what it is.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Well, how did you get back to the house? Remind us.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: From the shop?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I went into a white pickup truck.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You went in the white pickup truck? OK. And when you got into the house, where did you go?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: We've already discussed this. I took a shower. Whether I did things for a moment before I went to the shower -- I'm sure I talked to Maggie because she'd been gone. And if she came through the kennel which I believe she did, we only talk briefly. So, I would have talked to her but I would have quickly gone to take a shower.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. Going over to page 16, you would agree with me that the data reflects Maggie start logging steps and her phone disconnecting from the Mercedes around 8

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I agree at 8

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't see that but I don't dispute it.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Well, you see the purple line talking about it disconnected from the Mercedes -- (INAUDIBLE) --

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I do see -- I see where you talking about. So, yes --

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: -- at 8

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. So, what you can see that that appears to be when she arrived?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No. I don't believe that's when she arrived. I believe that -- I mean it was very normal for Maggie when she's driving to jump out of the car, run inside, go to the bathroom, do things and either send me or Paul or go back -- or Buster or go back to her car herself and unplug her phone, so -- I mean I agree that's when her phones unplug but I believe that Maggie got to the house a little bit before that. That's the whole reason why Paul and I went to the house.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. But you're saying Paul arrived after Maggie. Is that what you're saying? Got the house (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I believe so. Yes sir.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That's what I recall. And Paul arrived at the house after I arrived at the house. I believe. And if Paul got to the house around about the same time, he wasn't inside with Maggie and I when I get to the shower. WATERS

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Sir?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You said if Paul got the house prior to that, he wasn't inside with you and Maggie. Is that what you said?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I'm saying he was not inside when I went to get in the shower.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. But again, looking back at this data point, 8

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's what these records show.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: And it also shows that circle that folks testify to what the range of what it could --

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, absolutely.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: -- be within. So, I mean, it clearly could be --

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Look at that circle. Look at what's right in the middle of that circle. Almost like somebody drew a circle around the house, don't you agree?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Yes, I do. But also, in that circle is where you would park a truck if you pulled up.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: So, you know. And I'm not saying that he wasn't in the house at some point in time there. But when I wanted to get in the shower, he wasn't in the house. And he very easily could have been there and been parked in the yard.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Do you agree at the bottom of page 16 that at about 8

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Yes sir. That's what the data shows.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. It's the wrong button. And you agree with me that at about 8

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir. I agree that at 8

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. And then at 8

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir. That's correct.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And you would agree with me that it lasts about 50 seconds, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir. I agree with that.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And you would agree with me moving on to page 19 that both Maggie and Paul's phones locked for the final time at around 8

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That's what the data shows.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. After that, you would agree that Maggie's phone around 8

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That's what the data shows. Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Later then shows carrying over that's what it shows. Is that correct?
